text: Bottle.Dark reddish colour with medium white head.Aroma is sweet of ripped fruits and berries,yeast nots and taste of marzipan.Body is medium and lively with sweet and wwarming nots of fruits and yeast.

Originally rated on 12/23/2008. Aroma of banana, cherries, caramel, plums, raisins and yeast. Apperance was a nice deep rootbeer brown with plenty of yeast floaters, good carbonation and decent lace. Flavors of fruit at first with the caramel maltiness following, the alcohol was difficult to detect. Flavors constantly change with the warming temperatures. Overall a very nice brew thats worth a try

F: medium size to big, tan, average retention.
C: dark brown, opaque.
A: dark malt, chocolate malt, chocolate, dried dark fruits, caramel, candy sugar.
T: malty, dark fruits, cocoa, hint of coffee, roasted malt, caramel, spicy, cherries, honey, full body, low to medium carbonation, very tasty, balanced, fully enjoyed, 33cl bottle from Carrefour market  St. Michel @ Etterbeek, Brussels.

Color marrón claro, opaco y rojizo si le da la luz, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarronado de tres dedos de grosor (no demasiada retención). Carbonatación a tope visualmente pero mucho más sutil en boca. Muy cremosa. Aroma increíble a dark fruits, pasas, azúcar moreno, toque vinoso y alcohólico muy placentero, especias y un poco de chocolate. Una maravilla, recuerda a la Pannepot. Sabor que contiene todo lo anterior, dulce, con el chocolate y las pasas aun más presentes y final de ligero amargor y alcohol que la hace más compleja (el alcohol parece que va a estar más presente cuando la hueles pero en boca es más ligero de lo esperado, caliente un poco el gaznate en el primer y segundo trago y posteriormente el efecto se pierde y recuerda casi a algún vino. En retrogusto y postgusto quedan pasas y dark fruits por un tubo. Compleja, riquísima e increíblemente bien hecha. Para repetir y repetir y repetir...

Piwo w kolorze jasny brazowy z piana ktora bardzo szybko znika bez sladu. W aromacie belgijskie drozdze, suszone owoce i karmel. To samo mamy w smaku, wszystko bardzo poprawnie jak w dobrym klasycznym belgu.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A dark sparkling brown mahogany beer with a big of-white foamy head ; good retention ; many yeast sediments, what a pity... Roast, dried fruits, plum, bread, biscuit, dark fruits (red berries). Medium sweet, round ; warming atmosphere ; light dry bitter. Full body, light to medium silky texture, average to soft carbonation, lasting dry sweet warming finish. Overall, delicious !

Sample, but i bought some bottles. Will re-rate once tasted again. Dark brown with a creamy head. lively carbonation. Caramel, ripe banana, plum and yeast aroma. Taste is mostly sweet bit with a hint of sourness. some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle. Medium malty and medium yeasty of caramel, overriped fruits, dried fruits with notes of herbal and warm spices. Wineous. Starts heavy sweet but finish light bitter with some alcoholic warmth. Medium body and oily texture. Lively carbonation. A Nice one...
33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Enormément darômes dans cette bière très fruitée.

Bouteille 33cl, BB 16/12/2018.
Orange avec un léger doré, col beige, moyen retombant vite.
Arôme offre un bouquet malté caramel, pointe de pils, pâle, rétro de fruité confit, raisin sec, dates, pruneaux avec un caramélisé arrivant en complément, même une petite note noisette.
Palais est malté, caramel, pâle sucre candy ajoutant une petite note de douceur et de crystalisé - possible malt dark crystal? Biscuité avec impression de raisin sec, fruits noirs, amertume plaisant et noble sur la fin, note aussi une pointe de noisettes. Petite bière qui va se bonifier avec lage.

Bottle marked 16/02/2013, here just shy of four years later. Nose is sweet and richly estery, stone fruit of plums and apricots, then red berries, touch of cola. Very slow expander, but not a gusher, chestnut from the neck but dark brown in the glass, lots of sediment as I never seem to get a good pour from these, medium and very soapy tan head. Taste rich in candy sugar-like sweetness, surprising medium bitterness doesnt quite balance, very malty and dense with minimal hopping, lots of hazelnut and dark caramel, the gooey toffee stuff that adheres to the back of a spoon, but airy with those fruity esters, more banana and clove, some darker chocolate and roasty notes in the deep background, cola, raisin and brown sugar. Medium-full body, neither creamy nor crisp, but merely pleasantly smooth; alcohol is extremely well integrated and dangerously so. Very light herbal tones and a nice springtime green, somewhere between woodruff and mint; outright floral tones are very faint. Clean, bright, fresh, classy, tremendous. [2017.01.30: 4.2]

Bottle. Bought Dec 2015; BB date Nov 2016; Drank Dec 2016 - Dark Reddish Brown in colour. Medium creamy off-white head. Good lacing. Malty; caramel, brown sugar, chocolate notes. Fruity; dark fruits, raisins, plums. Spicy. Yeasty; heavily sedimented, phenomenal number of floaties. Hoppy; balancing hop bitterness. Warming alcohol. Sweet malty fruity spicy yeasty throughout. Enjoyable. Classy Dark Triple! (2016-12-23)

Dark brown colored, unclear, medium beige to tan frothy head. Aroma is of brown sugar, caramel, spices with some apple candy. Taste is very sweet malt and brown sugar, caramel, dried fruit, fruity candy, apple, spices, medium bitterness but a sweet finish, alcohol well hidden. Full bodied, average carbonation, sticky. Too sweet and sugary and bit cloying for me...
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Piana sycząca, gruba, szybko opada prawie do zera. Barwa rubinowo miedziana, opalizująca. W aromacie suszone owoce, kompot wigilijny, sfermentowane truskawki, głóg, przyprawy. W smaku półsłodko, dość klasycznie - rodzynki, figi, kandyzowany cukier, miód, trochę fenoli i te rozmrożone, dziwne truskawki... Goryczka ziołowa, niska, pikantna. Wysokie, musujące nagazowanie, nieźle ukryty, rozgrzewający alkohol.

Fajny BDSA, pijalny, nie mulący, choć motyw nadgniłej truskawki mi odrobinę przeszkadzał...

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Lichte gusher. Donkerbruin met een licht beige schuimkraag die snel inzakt. G: Karamel, gist, gedroogd fruit en kandij. S: Zoete karamelmout, wat moutbitterheid, chocolade en gedroogd fruit. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

Robe ambrée avec de fines particules surmontée dune mousse beige peu persistante et une forte carbonatation.Le nez est rapidement sur le malt , le sucre et lalcool..La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs de caramel et de sucre qui masquent lensemble.La finale est lourde et "pâteuse".Bière décevante et bien au dessous de lAbbaye des Rocs "Classique"!!!!!

Dégustée dans un verre Orval.
Température de début 10 à 11°.
Robe brun rouge avec beaucoup de sédiments surmontée dune faible et peu persistante mousse beige;
Nez sur le malt et le sucre candi.
Le gout est doux et dominé par la chaleur de lalcool avec une petite pointe damertume.
La finale de longueur moyenne est un peu trop sucrée.
Une déception et une bière très largement inférieure à lAbbaye des rocs "classique".
12,5/20

Bottle at home. Almost opaque dark brown with grayish off white head. Quite dark for a "tripel". Sweet roasted caramel and chocolate malts. Rye and barley. Grapes, dates, raisans, vanilla, chocolate, roasted almond, alcohol. Medium sweet, light bitter. Over medium body, soft fizzy carbonation. Sometimes a bit fishy ditchwater or maybe it just clashes a bit in a weird way with the cheese Im enjoying. Nice soft caramelized and buttery feel. Good taste and finish. Quite yeasty as well. Reminiscent of Rochefort but yeastier (from memory).

Medium mokka coloured head disapeares quick, brown coloured body, warming dark malts chocolat sweet caramel toffee like smell, medium carbonation low bitter sweet caramel malts fruity taste with some cacao like touch

Bottle from Bier Tempel. Dark brown colour, white foam. None of the yeasty clumps memtioned in other reviews. Nice sweetish malty and fruity brew. Some spicy hop to balance. Alcohol well hidden. Drinks very easily. Nice, but Ive had more complex brews in this style.

Pours a brown to beige head with sweet chocolate, nuts and almond aromas. Hazy and nice dark brown colored body. Rich and round in mouth with hints of cognac. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home, 2nd October 16. Pours a dark brown, loads of floating yeast, not good. Aroma is cararmel, bread, yeast, toffee. Taste is sweet and complex, brown sugar, cararmel, yeast. Not bad, but had better.
Bottle. Pours dark reddish, no head. Smells of young wine, sweet sourish grapes. No bitterness, sweet and a tad malty. You can smell the alcohol, but not taste it. Fresh. A great surprise.
bottle bb 6/7/18 ambrato carico quasi scuro velata schiuma media discreta persistenza fruttata leggere tostura lieve speziato buona secchezza alcool nascosto

0.33L bottle (from saveur biere). Pours dark amber with beige head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, belgian yeast, malt, fruits, sugar. Flavor is sweet, malt, fruits, sugar, caramel. Alcohol is covered by sweetness. Drinkability is really good. Overall: great malty beverage. Like many others have said before, this probably will age really well.

Bottle @ DØE "Øllets Dag"/Brdr. Schmidt, Viby centeret. Pours dark amber with a creamy light tan head. Aroma of malt, light caramel, light yeast, light wood, light sweetness, tart fruit, alcohol. Flavor is light sweet, malty, caramel, yeast, bread, light fruity, spice, alcohol. Thin to medium body, light carbonation, light warming alcohol in the finish. 030916

(6.3.2015) Samea punertavanruskea, tripleliksi varsin tumma olut todella suurella hiivapartikkeleiden määrällä höystettynä. Valkoista vaahtoa kiva parin sentin kerros tulppaanilasissa, mutta hiivojen pyöriminen ympäri lasia ei tee oluesta kovin kauniin tai houkuttelevan näköistä. Vahvassa miellyttävässä tuoksussa monenlaista hedelmää. Maussa hedelmää ja lievästi karamellimaista makeutta, muttei liikaa, alkoholi ei maistu läpi. Keskitäyteläinen suutuntuma. Toimiva olut tämäkin Abbaye des Rocsin tuotos.

Bouteille 330ml, gracieuseté delectrotype, merci Julien! Couleur brune opaque, plusieurs particules en suspension, mousse beige. Arôme de miel de sarrasin, levure, alcool. Goût de malt, légèrement caramélisé, levure, légère amertume. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-dense.
Shared with wim at his home. Brown colored beer with medium white head and no carbonation. Malty aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty spicy bitter.

W aromacie suszone owoce, cukier kandyzowany, podwyższony poziom melanoidyn, mniej karmelu. W smaku ponownie chlebowość na pierwszym planie, potem suszone owoce, lekka drożdżowa pikantność, dobrze ukryte alko. Nie jest złe, ale jest też trochę toporne, taki nazbyt estrowy doppelbock.
Bottle, Beers of Europe. Dark brown with an off white foam. Cola with vegetable fat. Herbal liquorice with sweet raisins and green apple. Yeasty, light spice finish. Decent.

Kastanjebruin bier met lichtbeige schuimkraag. Geur: gebrande mout, toffee, vanille, gedroogd fruit, rozijn. Smaak: zoetig, gedroogd fruit, vijg, wat sinaasappel, pruim. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Medium volmondig. Afdronk: zoetig.
Hazy amber, small fizzy white head. Malty, yeasty aroma, some fruit. Malty, caramely flavour, dried fruit and alcohol. Some light spice and brown sugar. Good.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2016 Bottle at home. Beautiful deep brown colour, beige foamy head. Sweet dried fruits like raisins and figs, caramel, brown sugar, Belgian yeasty spices. Lingering malt sweet aftertaste. Medium body, low-medium carbonation.
At Home along with Yves dark brown coloured body with an off white head and a roasted malt fruity hop aroma a spicy fruity caramel sweet alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep ruby, with a large light beige head, which lasts well and leaves good lacing. The aroma offers savoury, almost Vegemite-like notes, combined with tart berry and hints of spice and oak. There is a bit of funk up front, with plenty of spice, giving way to perhaps a touch too much alcohol heat in the mid-palate, although there are plenty of dark berry, red wine flavours going on. The finish sweetens, with a port aftertaste. A good Belgian ale, perhaps could be a bit more subtle on the alcohol, but otherwise very pleasant.

Bottled 330ml (Saveur Biere)
Dark amber color, small off-white head. Deep berryish, malty and sweetish aroma. Medium to full-boied. Robust Belgian yeast flavor: plums, raisins, malts, dark sugar. Hides alcohol very well. Soft palate. Good Belgian Strong Ale, but is a bit simple and sweet for being 3.9 here.

Versa nel bicchiere di color marrone scuro, leggermente opaco, una tonalità rubino intenso; schiuma abbondante, beige, cremosa, persistente. Un bel biglietto da visita! Laroma è complesso, molto ricco: caramello, biscotto, malto tostato, frutta scura (prugne, ciliegie, fichi e datteri), frutta secca e uva paasa; ottima e complessa speziatura. Corpo cremoso, morbido, vellutato, nasconde alla grande la presenza dellalcool (10%), buona complessità. Bel corpo, un sacco di dolcezza con note di uva sultanina, prugne, zucchero di canna e caramello, pane tostato e frutta secca, sentori di ciliegia, spezie e noce moscata. Carbonazione elevata, ma ben bilanciata.

Pullo @ Saveur-Biere. Kaatuu tulpaaniin hieman punaiseen vivahtavan ruskeana ja sameana, isokuplaisella ja pumpulisella vaahdolla, joka on noin 2,5 sormen paksuinen, joskin melko nopeaan katoava. Tuoksusta tulee vahvimpana tuhti marjaisen makea maltaisuus ja rusinaisuus. Myös luumua ja hieman raikkaampaakin hedelmää on joukossa. Kuvittelenko vain vai onko tässä myös hieman suklaisuutta? Tuoksu tuntuu paranevan joka nuuhkaisulla...sellainen 8+/8,5. Maku on selvemmän hedelmäisempi, ainakin alkuun. Luumua ja rusinaa on raikkamman päärynän tai vastaavan joukossa, loppua kohden jyhkeä maltaisuus tulee tasapainottamaan hedelmäisyyttä. Suutuntuma on hyvin hiilihappoinen ja melko täyteläinen, muttei hiveän makea. Laadukas ja riittävän monipuolinen vahva belgi. Hieno siemailuolut.

0.33l bottle. Dark amber to dark brown body, thin off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, dates, reisins, cocoa and caramel. Taste of cocoa, berries, chocolate, toast and plums. Sweet and quite fruity. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 butelka, warka do 12/03/2017. szampanska, znikajaca piana na jasnobrazowo-karminowo-bursztynowym piwie. niestety - sporo drobinek jakichs (nie wiem, czy chmieliny czy raczej drozdze, ale takie klaczki) plywa w piwie, co wygladowi nie robi dobrze. Aromaty fajne intensywne, glownie miod, suszone owoce (zwlaszcza figi kandyzowane, ale sa tez np morele), rodzynki, karmel... troche przyprawowosci (gozdziki zwlaszcza) w tle, troszke alkoholu slodkiego. w ustach ewidentnie slodkie, o lepkiej, syropowej nieco konsystencji, sa i kwaskowe lekkie nutki, dosc pelne, powtorka z nutek zapachowych (choc rownowaga nieco inna i pojawiaja sie nowe rzeczy jak np owocowosc wisniowa). goryczka niewysoka, ciut alkoholowa w odbiorze, dosc dlugie posmaki. dziwne wysycenie - nieby niewysokie a poszczypuje w jezyk. bardzo fajne, dobre i zlozone piwo. robi wrazenie. i wymyka sie klasyfikacjom.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
75 cl. Malty, sweet flavour. Nice body, pretty good aroma. It has the perfect combination of hops and malts. Overall, a very good Belgian Strong Ale.

33 cl bottle at Lágrimas Negras (Madrid), served in Bourgogne wine glass. Before I start, let me posit that although this beer is here stated as a Belgian strong ale and by the brewer as an imperial tripel, I can assure it is a monument of a quadrupel: dark brown, with loads of tertiary aromas; silky, sweetish, powerful (10%), without bitterness... That said, lets taste it. Pours reddish brown, deep and hazy, with a heavy tan head. Intense aromas of chocolate, red berries, tobacco, river pebbles, coffee and honey. In the mouth it feels creamy, soft and sweet. It develops a powerful and fresh taste, peaking on a very long finish with no bitterness whatsoever. Fantastic.

2007 Bottle shared at Kulminator. Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, toffee, sweet malt and light perfume notes. Flavour is heavy sweet. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Aroma: Caramel, fruits, brown sugar, chocolate, molasses, hint of alcohol. Appearance: Dark amber, tan 1-finger head. Taste: Medium sweet, fruits, alcohol, very complex. Palate: Full body, creamy slick texture, soft carbonation, long sweet finish. Overall: Very well balanced, complex beer, very similar to Grand Cru version, but not so "great" and also hint of alcohol is more obvious.

Volontaire et authentique, cette belle brune à de jolis reflets rougeâtres. Peu de mousse et un goût puissant esquissent un subtil mélange darômes de café grillé et de chocolat. Une petite bombe donc!

Bottle at home. Bit of a gusher. Dark mahogany with fizzy beige head. Dades, dried figs, milk chocolate, plums, raisins, lots of sweet malts, toffee, roasted dark bread, peach, dried sugared strawberries. Just lots of fresh and dried fruits with thick maltiness and some roasted and chocolate notes. Over medium sweet and light alcohol bitterness. Full bodied with mouthcoating carbonation and a light thin alcoholic finish. Wow this is again a great beer from Des Rocs.

Small frothy offwhite head. Fair lacing. Mostly diminishing. Dark-amber flat thick body. Aroma: moderate malt, chocolate, pear, port ruby, dried fruits. Initial flavor: moderate sweet (fruity, overwhelming caramel, alcoholic). Final flavor: moderate sweet light bitter (balances, but not enough); long duration. Palate: medium body, lively carbonation, metallic light alcoholic finish, watery/oily texture. Malty backbone. Light warming. Last glass with sediments galore. 160s usd15
Bottle. Dark chestnut, light floaties, low head. Berry, roast, wood aroma. Mellow medium body, light foamy. Nice fruity finish, dry wooden finish. Very nice and well balanced.

Amber color with tan head, with floatees. Aroma is prunes, figs, phenolic, toffee, no dark malts in the sense of coffee, just the dark fruits. Taste is prunes, toffee slight tartness, phenolic and tart finish. Typical high carbonation. I have high expectations of Des Rocs, and this did not disappoint - Awesome!
figs toffee raisins quite strong have tasted better belgian beers at mancbeerfest

Bottle from Bottle Baron. Hazy ruby/brown body with a lots of yeast chunks floating around below a thin off-white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of fig, red apple, nuts and peach. Flavour of toffee, red wine and raspberry syrup. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Light fizz. The alcohol is well hidden but it does not drink easily.

Pas si extraordinaire que cela. Loin de la même.
Nez caramelisé, légèrement épicé, sur fond de levure.
Bouche à lattaque plutôt franche et épicée. Assez équilibrée, on part sur la réglisse en dominante, une pointe danis. Cela reste assez rond avec le fond caramelisé. Le tout est vite dissipé et offre aucune longueur tant la fin est aqueuse.
Bonne mais manque de caractère.
Meh. Ingen favorit. Lite för stark för att inte ha så mycket smak. Domnar munnen  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Une bière énorme tant par sa robe profonde à la mousse crémeuse que par son nez puissant et complexe, épicé et fruité. La bouche nest pas en reste, la matière est imposante, la bulle est onctueuse et la finale à la fois riche et équilibrée. Un délice absoilu.

Pours red-brown with huge yellow-beige dense rocky head. Aromas of caramel, sarsparilla, plum, cherry. The taste has caramel, dates, raisin, chocolate, lightly roasted grains, high alcohol well hidden. Medium bodied, lightly oily. Quite different but very enjoyable belgian strong/dark tripel.
From elcervecero. In Teku glass. Watching Narcos 1x03. Superb aroma. Good taste, but I miss a bit more thickness.

Bottle from Kris Wines, Holloway. Brown pour with a light beige head. Aromas of chocolate, bonfire toffee, treacle and raisin. Lots of warm, sweet spicy flavours- pepper, chocolate, raisin and candy sugar. Long boozy finish. Nice.

Mahogany color with beige head. Aroma has green coffee, a bit of liquorice, toffee and molasses. Taste follows with dried dark fruits, light coffee and toasted malts. Very balanced between the sweet toffee and dried fruits and the roasty, coffee like notes. Body is quite heavy with a good amount of carbonation. This one is quite different from other dark belgian ales. It has some similar yeast quality but the used malts distinguish it from the others. I definitely recommend this one.

Bottle. Deep copper/reddish with tiny to medium light brown head. Poor lacing and head retention. Very rich, complex aroma of caramel, toffee and dark fruits. Taste is semi-sweet neither too sweet nor dull. Medium to full body, creamy/sticky texture, finish is semi-sweet. In general very complex and interesting beer. Definetely worth trying.

330mL bottle from International Beer Collector. BB 05/02/2017
Really good looking beer - holds a well-sized creamy off-white head atop a reddish copper body.
Aroma is complex, quite rich; dark caramel, biscuity, nutty malts, dark fruits of plum and cherry, dried fruits of raisin & dates, savoury pepper & spice, perhaps a touch of leafy hop there too.
Creamy body, smooth, velvety, hides that big 10% amongst layers of sticky malt & complexity.
Lovely body - plenty of sweetness with notes of sultana, prune, dark sugars & burnt caramels, toast & nuts, counterpointed tangy plum & cherry esters & somewhat savoury clove, pepper & nutmeg spice. Bitterness lifted for style but well measured, warming but very subtle on a long smooth finish.
Top notch, once again this brewery, their beers have a beautiful complexity & balance & texture about them - this is no exception!
Bottle from G&B, Hammel. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma and taste is sweet malts, caramel, dark dried fruits, hint of chocolate, yeast. Full body, Soft carbonation. Sweet alcoholic finish.
33cl bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark red brown color. Thin white head. Medium high sweetness, light sourness. Flavour is light balsamic vinegar, malt, light chocolate, bubblegum, citric.

hazy mahogany colour, huge beige-ish head; aroma of dried fruits (figs, plum, some raisin), some earthy notes, hints of cocoa, biscuit, yeast and alcohol; taste is the same with some vanilla; spicy alcoholic aftertaste; great Belgian strong ale

Lehengerlő megjelenésű, igazi keményvonalas belga főzet mahagóni színben pompázó testtel, krémes, tojashéj árnyalatú eszpresszó-habbal. Sejtelmes hangulatot áraszt, óvatosan nyilatkozik meg, klasszikus aromái méltóságteljesen tárulkoznak ki, melynek során krémes, datolyás-aszalt szilvás, mandulás-diós, apátsági illatok keverednek elő a pohárból. A krémesség foka egyre nő, ízjegyek formájában elevenednek meg az előbbi hangulatok, s már az első korty alkalmával elismerően nyugtázhatjuk, mennyire értenek a belgák a letisztult vonalak alkalmazásához főzeteik szerkezetének kialakításakor. Csípőskés testét quadrupel-szerű karakterek tarkítják, vaníliás lepelbe burkolt aszalványok sorakoznak fel, vörösboros pátosz nehezedik rájuk, a gabonás alapokon így csúsznak tovább selymesen és könnyedén, légiesnek tüntetve fel a mázsás súlyú főzetet.

Big bottle from France 44. Ruby brown with small white head. Very high sediment. Sour tart nose full of alcohol. Full and yeasty . Dark fruit. Did I mention the sediment? Tart. Taste is nice but I feel like Im chewing this.
Bottle. A brown beer. Fruit spice aroma also comes through in the flavour into a very pleasant sensory experience. I dont really like most AdR beers, but this is outstanding.

Pint 9 shared poured a medium brown with off white head. The aroma is sweet malts and dark fruits and hops. This is an old bottle. The flavor is very very good. Sweet malts melding with dark fruits and the hops are an after thought. Overall ufvthisxwad fresher probably would be off the chart but no complaints here.

Pours a dark body with a thin head. Faint sweet aroma. Nice malty taste with tones of dried fruit and bread.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big bottle picked up at Total Wine and Spirits in Burnsville. Unfortunately consumed in a pint glass with no other options available. Mahogany in color with minimal head due to the type of glass. Looks slightly tan. Very little aroma initially. Taste is more mild than anticipated with sweet caramel and malt running the show. Alcohol presence felt. Almost a slight chocolate hint at the end. Kind of reminds me of Killians. Not a compliment. Mouthfeel has some effervescence but finishes rather mildly. Bit of a disappointment.
Donkerbruin bier met weinig schuim. Fles 75cc. Smaak is licht bitter en licht zoet, caramel, en chokolade. Erg goed, echter niet echt intens van smaak.
Bottle. Pours in dark body with medium tan head. Aroma has roasty character, yeasty notes, caramel. Taste has high sweet caramel tones. Low earthy bitterness. Body is full, medium carbonation

Esta cerveza de color cobre oscuro, posee un sabor fascinante debido a los diferentes tipos de cebada que utiliza. Es una bebida excelente y muy elegante que induce a pensar que fue hecha exclusivamente para los reyes y emperadores. Su paladar es completo, con una conjunción de sabores a ricos albaricoques, melocotones, dulce de cítricos, frutas confitadas que hacen de esta cerveza sea absolutamente deliciosa y muy difícil de dejar.

Bottle from 2007 @ Kulminator, Antwerpen - BE. Color: dark brown beer with no carbonation and no foam. Smell: star anise nose. Caramel, malt, brown sugar and yeast finish. Small oxydation but not so present, and attenuate with the degustation. Taste: very nice density, good caramel and malt palate. Notes of anise and brown sugar. Spice finish, and oxydation. Taste: caramel, malt, sugar and yeast.
@ Hotel Van Belle, Brussels 150514. Bottle from local minimarket. Dried fruity with berries and nutty notes, also some malt. Body is medium.
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2016 Kijk uit met inschenken, want dit bier spuit uit de fles. Verder: prima bier. Donker, veel gistdeeltjes, rijke aroma, goede smaak. Niets mis mee.

Bottle, 24/06/15, thanks bluus. Pours a dark auburn brown with a stylish, dark beige head. Aroma is spicy, flowery, light coffee, ripe, dark fruit. Taste is some yeast, ripe, dark fruits aplenty, prune, some spiciness, cinnamon. Full.

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Hazy dark red-brown in colour with a sweet red fruit, plum and currant flavour, liquorice notes with warming sherry, vanilla and oak on the spicy, warming, creamy finish. Excellent!

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a billowing foamed head with active yeast spotting along the foam peaks. Aroma has dried pitted fruit, yeast and alcohol. Flavor is fairly sweet up front with some lingering booziness. Aftertaste has grape and prune notes.

@ Hotel Van Belle, Brussels 150514. Bottle (330 ml) from local minimarket. Fruity and malty with spicy and light nutty notes, dried fruits, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, sweet and fruity.

Intense maltiness, caramel, dried fruits, ripe fruits, bit yeasty, very light warming alco finish. Mostly sweet with light bitterness and touch of sourness.
Enjoyable indeed, but cant call it extraordinary.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2015 Couleur brune, reflets ambrés, légère mousse beige. Nez fruité et levures belges, caramel et fruits noirs. Gout fruits noirs, caramel, malt, alcool, levures, épices. Bon corps cremeux, rond en bouche, fin longue et intense fruité noirs et alcool.

Bottle 33cl, shared by Calisky, a dark beer with low head. Nose is on spices, yeast, caramel, complex, nose of a quadruple beer. Aroma is on caramel, spice, plum, yeast notes, dray grapes, cinnamon, vinous, quite complex, good body. Finish is on toasted caramel, yeast, plum, very nice.
Amber with small beige head. Sweet malty aroma. Malt taste mixed with roasted bitterness and some other different notes. Bitter aftertaste.
33cl ;Its nice to know this was once popular with emperors ... A deep rich malt palate ...Gets u buzzed fast. Good silky smooth elegance here.

Brune claire, mousse avec des reflets cuivrés, la mousse laisse une belle dentelle sur le verre en retombant. Nez très complexe de fruits secs (raisins, marrons, pruneaux), pudding, alcool. Bouche assez complexe également, Fruits secs, alcool, levure, épices. Légèrement sucrée, légèrement amère, corps important, alcool omniprésent à tous les stades. Très très bonne bière !
330ml bottle from Saveur Biere. Pours a deep brown with nice tan head. Lots of smooth malt, dried fruits & sweet candi sugar with a robust alcohol presence. Excellent beer.

Dark brown colour. Aroma of dark malts, caramel, raisins, dark fruit and hops. The same is the taste. Alcohol is notable. Overall Very good but for me still not in the same rang with the best beers of this style.
Bottle at home. Brown cloudy. Aroma is liquorice, anise, malts. Taste is malty, yeasty, liquorice.

13/03/2015 sample from 33 cl bottle @ beertasting by Jerre, Melden.
Hazy brown with nice head. Aroma : Malts, raisin, toffee. Taste is malts, yeast, licorice, caramel, some bitterness. Nice mouthfeel. 2nd beer I had that feels like a liquid "praline". Abbaye des Rocs rocks!
Very much a typical triple in my experience and very nice for it. Fruit, hop and malt in great balance. A touch sweet but not too much.

Pours a dark amber liquid. Dont know what it smells like but it makes me not wanna drink it. Taste is not really that great. Dont know perhaps this bottle has gone bad or i really dont like this beer. To be continued...
Draught at Beer Trappe. Big boozy brown sugar and caramel beer that makes me think barley wine more than anything. Tasty but big.

Copenhagen 19/10 2014. 75 cl bottle brought by my brother in law. Shared the bottle. Pours golden brown and hazy with big beige head. Big chunks of yeast whirling around at the bottom. Aroma is concentrated, Spicy and fruity. Medium carbonation. Taste is surprisingly light for a beer containing 10 % of alcohol. You can taste the alcohol but in no unpleasant way. Ripe fruit. Spices. Good Belgian trippel.

Cerveza de coloración ambar intenso y reflejos cobrizos. Buena formación de espuma y estabilidad. Aromas afrutados y dulces con notas de bizcocho, galleta y suave caramelo. Buena correspondencia entre el aroma y el sabor, aparecen notas levemente ahumadas. Amargor bajo. Cuerpo medio y buena carbonatación. Retregusto maltoso, y con cierto dulzor residual. Alcohol bien integrado.

Might be considered as Strong Belgian Ale but compared to Quad, this beer has more body and interesting taste. Intensive dried fruit and vanila, toffee flavors. Rich, complex but balances and quite easy to drink to be honest. I had no problems to finish the glass very quickly. Belgian magic.

33cl bottle bb11/2016. Fizzy dark brown Coke pour, OK head. Rum raisins, cherry coke and some cinnemon-spiked strawberry marmelade in the nose. More soaked raisins, bareable fruit sweetness in taste, non cloying, with a finishing spice. Excellent natural & organic big brew, just not quite my style this monumental and alcoholic, more than just an appetizer in any case.

Lightly clouded chestnut brown, tan head, medium coarseness that fades fast to nothing, big, unappealing clots of sediment float up to top/ are suspended. Yuck! Aroma is sweet herbal grass, lightly spiced bread, clove, hints of licorice, cinnamon, raisins, touch of caramel. Body is medium, syrupy-oily, light, soft, and slightly flat carbonation. Flavor is medium-light caramel, biscuit, grass, white raisin and honey. Touch of herbs with a slightly medicinal note in the finish. Overall, an OK-tasting BDSA, but the (excessive clots of) sediment in the pour really makes it unappealing to me. Needs some more carbonation too.
Hazy dark brown colour, beige foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, liquorice and brown sugar. Malty body. Light sweet, bitter finish. Very well balanced. Very good beer.
Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Pours brown with floaties and a beige head, aroma dark bread, stale, flavor of dried fruits, alcohol, celery, dark bread, medium bodied.

A beautiful, dark red beer with a medium, dense and beige head. The aroma is great and aromatic. Sweet and fresh fruits, port wine, some plums and caramell, also citrusfruits. Taste is strongly fruitful, orange peel, some dark fruits and citrusfruits, hint of spices. Medium+ bodied, strong and smooth carbonation. Surprisingly fresh and even too easy to enjoy. Strongly fruitful and nicely sweet beer. Positive surprise, tremendous beer!

750ml bottle from Beers of Europe, shared with jeevan. Pours clear deep copper, off-white head. Aromas of dark stone fruit, raisins, dark candi sugar. Taste is light sweet, syrup, more fruit. Clean finish. Hides the strength. Good stuff.
Old 750ml bottle. Brown color with brown head. Malty, chocolate, syrup. Candi sugar, drop, some old bottle effect. Very smooth almost creamy MF. Sweet. Nice beer
Lasting white pillow about a cloudy deep brown body. Nose of marshmallows, toasty malt, with minor hop background. Some decent depth in this beer. Very interesting.

Leicht trübes dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit einer geringer aber stabilen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifen Früchten, roten Waldbeeren, minimal säuerlich, Karamell. Geschmack röstmalzig, schokoladig, dann reife Früchte, Dörrobst, sehr aromatisch, nur leicht alkoholisch.

330ml bottle (tasting @VastActive place, thanks). Clear copper color. Sweet, yeasty, faint fruity aroma. Taste is classic belgian for me. In that condition I really cant tell if there is any aspects of alcohol in taste. Getting pretty drunk. Sorry :( (if possible re-rate).

I always think im going to hate beers with ugly labels. I see a beer thats well rated in a style I dont really care for and I buy it because of the rating. Once I get it home its a beauty contest and if your label is ugly you dont get picked. This beer is like the unmarried 38 year old spinster with one untrimmed chin hair sitting at the end of the bar drinking a tom collins and eating cashews by the handful. Shes not easy on the eyes but go sit down and talk to her and I guarantee shes got stories. Youll probably enjoy your time more then sitting next to the cute little boring girl thatll waste your time with the same boring stories and try and get you to buy her drinks. In short this beers a 38 year old spinster with one chin hair. I hope you found this review helpful.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks zvikar. Opens with the brewerys signature gusher. Hazy amber with lots of floaties. Aroma of malt, caramel, biscuits, dark fruits and a bit of alcohol. Sweet flavor with caramel, oxidation and dark fruits. Medium-bodied. A bit oxidized, nothing exciting.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 17/04/2016, courtesy of VastActiv, 20141122) The beer poured brown and clear. Its head was small and white. Aroma had dark fruits, sweetness and malts. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, caramel, yeast, grass, malts and bitterness. Afteraste was sweet and bitter. A tasty and clean strong Belgian ale.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Helsinki. Colour is reddish brown with very small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, raisins, spices, some sweetness, Belgian yeast and malts.

This bad boy sat on the shelf. Its all it did. Im sure that it sat on the shelf in Belgium, sat on a shelf at the importer, then sat on a shelf at a store for years im sure. Then sat at my shelf for over a year. It was actually pretty tasty. Very nice big belgian yeast flavors, and malts. Not cloying or boozy at all. A Shocker. Nicely done.

33cl bottle. Pours hazy dark reddish amber with a ton of yeast flakes floating. Quickly disappearing off white head. Aroma is sweet and roasted malts, molasses, plums, raisins cherries, light buttery note. Taste is similar, good malty base with some burnt sugar and fruity notes again. Medium body, medium carbonation. Excellent
Redish brown, 1 finger tan head. Aromas of yeast, red fruit, sweet malt. Quite malt forward with estery red fruit. Dangerously drinkable at 10%, refreshing.

Bottle from Sugaya. Yeasty nose, with sweet fruit, brown sugar, and a bit of licorice. Dark brown color with amber edges, thin filmy head, and some goos lacing. Fruity initial, deep and rich, sweet dried fruits -- raisins, light prunes, snd berries, and some alc. warmth. Medium body, but quite light on the tongue. The alcohol is masked pretty well, but it is definitely warming. Complex, sweet, and rich.
This Brasserie is always surprising me. Another excelente beer from them. 10% very well balanced.

Brown body and beige head. Sweet malts, cake, sticky figs, some weak coffee. Taste isnt as concentrated, probably quite some sugar used here because the alcohol is there without much body. Bit too Prickly carbonation, even within the style. Its a tat bit disappointing. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Location: Draft at Morrisons, 10/15/14, Palindromic Rating #4004!


Aroma: This ale has a very sweet aroma, there is heavy toffee, with some caramel, and dark fruit

Appearance: It pours a reddish brown color with a tan head and some drippy, coating lace

Flavor: Tastes heavy sweet, similar to the nose component-wise, with no bitterness to speak of

Palate: This is a rather full bodied offering, it feels fairly sticky, and finishes with some mild heat

Overall Impression: 
I love me some palindromic rating numbers!  Anyway, this is a solid, strong, sweet brew.  The alcohol hides well under the heavy sweetness, which is impressive at 10-12% (was listed at 12% on the chalk board at the bar, and is listed as 10% on here).  Big, stick, and sweet.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
A: Aggressive carbonation when opened. The foam practically jumped off the bottle... However, after pouring it, the beige head was medium with small retention and no lacings are left. As a traditional Des Rocs, the body is dense and dirty full of yeasts floating around
S: Traditional Belgian dark ale. Very fruity and yeasty. Notes of plums. Bready too. Shake it a bit and the perfume jumps out to the nose. Caramel malts and some hops. Bit liquorous. Pure pleasure
T: Taste follows the nose. Quite fruity. Plums and raisins are there. Complex and spicy. Sweet upfront. Light bitter end. Strong taste of Belgian yeasts and a peculiar ash aftertaste
M: Expectable creamy body. Medium to low carbonation. A bit molasses
D: High. Lovely Beer
[ BA Review @ 11/13/2010 ]
dark belgian beer with too much caramel. thought I was drinking Coke. Not bad but wont buy again

"i dont really get the fuss. i was excited to find 3 top hundred beers ive yet to try, but i hope the other two are better. maybe this was better at the source - but i doubt most of the beerpals had one that hadnt been disturbed in transit. best before 2011, erupted yet again on the pour, plenty of floaties. mish-mash aroma and flavor of the usual suspects...dark fruit like plum fig and prune, but with a slightly unpleasant note. mouthfeel nice with some warming alcohol. taste is ok, but nothing to suggest a 99th% beer. ive had belgians ive liked plenty, but i guess i think there are too many at the top, and unless i got a bad one, this is one of em."

Bottle @ home. Clear dark orange to reddish color, medium sized quickly diminishing beige head. Aroma is malts, overripe fruits, a bit sweet. Taste malts, sweetish, overripe fruits, molasses, slightly herbs or spices and perhaps a touch of yeast. Quite nicely balanced actually. Medium body and carbonation. Quite nice.

Brun acajou, effervescence moyenne et soyeuse, col beige fin. Après une entrée toute en malts, cest la fête au palais: fruits noirs assez présents, un peu de réglisse, un peu de moka, un peu de miel, un rien dépices, une bonne petite amertume, un peu de chaleur dalcool. Que du plaisir!

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2014 The label says Brasserie des Rocs Triple Impériale, apparently made for export to North America. Creamy, light beige, dense head, very dark mahogany colour with ruby hue and tiny yeast particles floating everywhere. Rich, sweet Belgian chocolate aroma of dates, chocolate liqueur, port wine, brown sugar, cloves, gingerbread, liquorice, cranberries, candied cherries, honey and pine needles. Soft and rich, mellow taste of dark candied fruits, port-like, with a mineral-like carbonation, full and nutty malt base, oily and thick, creamy mouthfeel, ending in a flowery hoppy finish with warming alcohol. Now this is the kind of rich, opulent, profound beers that stand equivalent to our famous chocolates. I love this - though I still have something against the use of dark and triple in combination with each other, lets just agree that these so-called dark triples should always be classified as quadrupels.

Appearance: bottle frothed out when opened; the pour was muddy brown, clouded with vast colonies of chunky floaties; head was creamy light tan, slightly rocky and studded with dark brown spots--in short, it looked a mess.  Aroma: 	strong nose of raisin, clove, cinnamon, sticky toffee, caramel, figs, dark fruits, candi sugar, cinnamon.  Taste: very sweet, with caramel, toffee, crème brulee, cherries in heavy syrup, candi sugar, raisins, prunes, fig, light bourbon, clove, and cinnamon spice.  Finish: lingering sweet flavors like an oatmeal raisin cookie, with yeasty notes growing more prominent.  Notes: Bottle was best before 2-22-2014, so about 7 months past. Possibly explains the gusher and appearance, although at 10% youd think it would keep a little better. In spite of the frankly gross appearance, this had a great aroma and wonderful, deep flavors. Alcohol was remarkably well-hidden. Just awfully hard to get past the dying pond-like appearance.

330ml bottle from Saveur Biere. BBE 20/03/2016.


Brown nectar with a creamy head. Sweet aroma and taste, spices. Feels mellow. Nice mouth-feel and ABV is hidden. Pleasant.

Bottle vintage 2007 @ the Kulminator.
Thin creamy white head. Burgundy pour. slightly sour. Still very good

Small beige head dark misty brown pour mild carbonation aromas caramel yeast toffee boozy note spice plum citrus fig cherry the flavours sugary candy toffee caramel cherries orange yeast goodness sweet fig port alcohol plum cinnamon anise lovely flavours through out good stuff from Desmond or Mr rocs as I call the finish smooth yet sweet and lovely richness on palate fruits abound rich malts spices a high class ale no doubt

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur marron aux reflets rouges. Bières très aromatique : du pruneau, du caramel, de la frangipane, de la réglisse. Pour ne rien gâcher, elle développe en bouche une texture soyeuse et agréable. Trouvée à Roby - Menin.

Color castaño claro, escasa capa de espuma beige que desaparece pronto, en nariz aromas a malta tostada, caramelo, frutos rojos y licor. En boca entrada potente y maltosa, bastante dulce; pos gusto largo y sin apenas amargor tornándose algo seco al rato. Sus diez grados se acaban sintiendo aunque está bien integrado, buen cuerpo con carbónico bajo, buena cerveza aunque parece doble

750 ml bottle at home from backlog notes 07/08. Pours a hazy reddish brown color with a medium sized beige head. There was some sediment floating around. The aroma and flavor have sweet caramel, dark fruit, raisins, plums, figs, yeast, chocolate, candi sugar, a hint of the alcohol. This is a solid drinking beer that I would have again.

Bière triple black impériale titrant à 10 % abv. Donc pas seulement bien sûr une belgian
strong ale, mais une triple destinée aux rois et empereurs  ainsi quaux amateurs inscrits
sur ratebeer !!!
Couleur brun foncé et roux en transparence.
Clarté nette. Bulles par milliers fines et vives.
Mousse beige clair qui nappe bien.
Arômes de bois de fût, miel noir, fruits mûrs, pointe légère de réglisse.
1ère bouche veloutée sur un merveilleux ensemble malt/houblon très riche.
Arrière-bouche dune rondeur et ampleur fantastiques.
2ème bouche à lharmonie sublime et la complexité grandiose.
3ème avec une pointe fine de banane et candi blanc.
Arrière-bouche alternant malt et fruits confits.
La longueur commence en développant toutes les nuances, puis travaille lampleur et la
profondeur.
La levure est fine, complexe, tout simplement grande.
Lalcool offre une magnifique progression sur la longueur, en portant ce breuvage sur 
lautel.
La finale donne des nuances de raisins secs, miel fin et une fine pointe de cannelle.
CONCLUSION : lart merveilleux du brassage est ici représenté dans toute sa plénitude,
nous avons un breuvage effectivement digne des rois et des empereurs. 
Nous buvons heureusement à leur table  Cheers !!

75cl bottle shared with S&G tasting group.
APPEARANCE: clear dark blond beer, unstable off white head.
NOSE: too sweet, caramel.
TASTE: too sweet, caramel, too unidimensional... Very boring and disappointing.

This is a very complex, intriguing dark tripel. Pours amber/orange with a thick beige head that lingers, lots of sediment when you hold it to the light. Aroma is of caramel, sweet malt, dark bread, nuts, plum, cherry, and an attic in an old house. Taste is medium sweet and mildly bitter, very fruity, complex, and balanced. Has a silky mouthfeel, although it looks aggressively carbonated in the glass. Has vinous qualities, like a good port. Long, mellow, sweet finish. Has a best before date of Feb 16, 2013 on the bottle but I think it isnt too old, the age has probably improved the flavor. Would like to check out more styles from this brewery.

Bottle: Served in a shaker:
Quite a big beige foamy head with a clear amber brown colored beer.
Aroma has lots of red fruit and caramel and hints of flowers, sweets, soap, sweet malts, some sweet wood and some red fruit candy sweets (slight).
Flavours of red fruits, cream, malts, bitters, some sweets, light herbs, some caramel, some wood ish tones, some sweet nuts and caramelised hay/grass.
Aftertaste is malty, red fruits, bitters, some herbs and light caramel.
Low carbo, creamy to silky mouthfeel, medium to fuller bodied and a light creamy to oily texture.
This is very nice indeed!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle bought some place I cant remember. pours deep reddish brown with tons of sediment and a frothy beige head that leaves lots of trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty, fruity and phenolic with sweet dark bread, caramelized apples, baked pears, caramel, raisins bran, dry wood, alcohol, marzipan, golden syrup, lemon peal, plums, dates and black pepper corns. Taste is sweet, very tiny bitter, malty, fruity and phenolic with sweet dark bread, caramel, toffee, hay, wood, dates, figs, raisin bran, baked apples and pears, rose water, marzipan, lemon peal and alcohol. Mouthfeel is round, tiny dry, champagne-like, tiny boozy, soft and near full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, tiny bitter, fruity and phenolic with dark bread, baked pears, dates, figs, caramel, toffee, hay, dry soil and alcohol. Massive beer that manages to stay balanced. A tasty treat indeed.

Bottle, shared with Parksy. I expected a trippel style belgian ale based on my misinterpretation of the label, so I was surprised at the dark colour of the pour. The flavour profile is completely different from a trippel as well. Sweet bready malts, lots of figgy fruit, lightly alcoholic finish. Not as smooth or complex as the grand cru, but still immensely enjoyable.

text: Pours dark red with thick white head. Aroma is fruity, caramel and yeasty. Flavour is sweet, malty, spicy, fruity and caramel.

Definitely, I am a fan of Brasserie des Rocs. For sure, they havent the name or the prestige of another breweries or abbeys, but their beers are excellent, very serious and very...just to say, Belgian. Like this one, with a high presence of the yeast and the candi sugar both in mouth and nose, getting a relatively complex, well structured and balanced beer. The overall is extremely elegant and delicate, but high bodied: an iron fist wrapped in a silk glove. Great.

Bottle from Utobeer. A serious gusher. Pours murky red, huge head endures, loads of sediment. Looks pretty rubbish. Smell - sherry and coffee - smells aged. After a while I start getting more cherry. Body - medium to light, foamy, low carbonation. Taste - sweet yet earthy, malty, dark fruit, caramel. Drying alcoholic finish. It tastes similar to a modern barley wine.  A bit of a mixed experience - looks awful but tastes pretty good, and thats the most important thing.

Bière vraiment surprenante aux effluves de tire sainte Catherine, sucrée au nez. Légèrement sucrée au goût, note de caramel sans goûter la scotch ale.

Bottle. Pours dark amber with a small off-white head. Malty and spicy yeast aroma with hints of dark fruit and alcohol. Fairly sweet malt flavor with spicy yeast notes, dark fruit and a hint of wood. Spicy yeast, dark fruits and alcohol in the finish.

33cl bottle. Tried to prevent sediment from pouring into the glass but it seems to start almost from the beginning. Dark amber with a beige head, various sized pieces of sediment. Sweet, raisin, some prune, alcohol, liege style waffles, figs. Very sweet but very different from most sweet beers I have had as its an intense fruity sweetness with some alcohol, mild carbonation, full body, sweet finish. Not sure I would want an entire bottle to myself but if you like sweet and belgian candy sugared beers then this is for you.

Thanks to tastybeer for sharing this with b3shine and myself. Despite a considerable amount of sediment in the bottle this was a solid beer. I thought I had tried it before but it must be one of those beers Ive always walked past until it was no longer for sale.

Aroma / Appearance - Heavy chunks of yeast from a year or more of aging give it an unappealing look. When it finally (somewhat) clears the body has a pleasant caramel color. Cherry pie, red vines, caramel brownies, and dark fruits provide a mixture of good flavors from which to start.

Flavor / Palate - Caramel, spice, and chocolate are very smooth when not swallowing a chunk of thick yeast. Working around that it leads to a warm finish. The booziness isnt too intense yet manages to become evident about halfway through the glass. If not for the issue of sediment this would be a clear 4.0+.
By all means a solid Tripel, but again, the Brune is where its at with these gents.
Bottle. Ruby pour, small tan head. No retention/little lace. Aroma of dark fruit, fruity ester, cherry. Taste is sweet, plum, cherry, fruity ester. Palate is soft, slick, sweet finish.

750 ml to tulip (shared by tastybeer). Looks subpar; LOTS of sediment though. Amberish brown with off-white head that dissipates into lacing and sediment out the wazoo. Smells of dark fruit and Belgian yeast with a fairly sweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Solid beer, but the appearance really detracts from its overall pleasantness.

Poured from a large bottle into a trappist-style glass to drink. The beer had a deep, cloudy amber color with a slight brownish hue and some light, noticeable sediment. It had an enormous foamy and bubbly off-white head with good retention, leveling off to a modest-sized head, along with excellent cling and lacing. The aroma featured a nice array of floral notes mixed with some dark fruits and a candy and sugar effect as well, but could have been a bit more pronounced. Its taste was mostly sweet with a slight sour touch that had soft, dark fruit notes, along with a sweet candy component. The beer was soft and subtle on the palate, with average levels of carbonation and life, but had a filling, creamy mouthfeel and was a touch dry.

Donker amber/bruin met minimale witte kraag, jammer dat het gistdepot wat los is gekomen
Aroma: zoet, caramel, rozijn, pruimen, donker fruit

Pours dark cloudy brown with creamy thick head.

Very taste quadrupel/barley wine/sweet imperial stout of the masters of Abbaye des Rocs. Taste is complex and rich with notes of dark fruit, raisin, dark chocolate, coffee and some spices. Great beer.

Bottle from a shop in Belgium, bought in 2011. Fruity and sweet smell, berries, raisins and almonds. Similar taste. Very strong carbonation, it got allot better when I rolled the glass for a while. Very nice beer, lots of flavour, rich and complex.
Draft at crunchy's. garnet with minimal head. Dark fruit and candi aromas. Sweet and sticky. Astringent.

To brew good beer, you have to drink good beer. While I believe that I could possibly clone this beer at some point in the future, I spent last weeks Saturday brewing a pale and enjoying a bottle of this fine Belgian. 

First, this is unfiltered to some extremity. Typically, the first step in creating a clone is in acquiring its yeast; that wouldnt be a problem with this brew. Yeast was suspended throughout the beer, pendling a high viscosity and tremendous mouthfeel and body, even with little or no agitation. There is no way to avoid having a mouthful of bread-tan culture lodged in the teeth after consumption. 

Appearance was deep, opaque amber, with natural yeast carbonation, mostly from the walls of the glass.

Big, mildly roasted malt character, with an emphasis of toasted nuts and raisins, without losing the candi sugar character that should dominate the style. While I have read reviews with leather, banana, sulfur-ish, and skunky flavors present, I wonder how many received a mistreated masterpiece. No off-flavors present to my palate.

Hops were almost entirely muted, barely riding the finish of the beer after a long and complex transition. 

Aroma was intense and prevailed in bread and an effervescent citrus. 

LOL Paired well with hamburgers. Everything does? We had no choice in the matter, as our host brewer has prepared ahead of time and had no prior knowledge of pairing. 

I look forward to my next bottle and will ranch the yeast to prepare for exercises in futility. Anyone out there speak Flemish?

Deep brownish/reddish/copper in color with a tan head. Huge and complex flavor with dried fruit, malt, and earthiness. Alcohol is masked, but this is certainly a strong bodied and strong flavored beer that would overwhelm some.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2012 75 cl bottle @ Delirium Café, Brussels. Rated on 18.07.2010
Aroma is rather strong with dark, ripe fruits and spices. Also hints of alcohol. Flavour is rather strong but kind of smooth with ripe fruits and spices. Very smooth palate. Some warming alcohol comes through but it doesnt disturb much. 8+3+7+5+16=3.9
33 cl bottle, BBE 19.05.2013
Blind tasting @ lusikka
Aroma is very sweet with lots of sugar, some dark fruits, berries and toffee typical to Belgian Ales. Flavour is rather sweet with sugar, dark fruits and toffee. Some warming alcohol in the finish. Foamy palate. Too sweet and too much berries here. Quite different than the big bottle two years ago. My guess was Kasteel Donker. 7+3+7+3+16=36

Brownish amber deep pour thin creamy beige head .... aroma is of dark fruits, caramel malts and grainy .... taste is caramel malts, dark fruits, grainy little bit of abv and a spicy taste best warmer and not cold .... lingering dry fruity finish

Bottle. Poured brown with a thin off-white head. Large floating particles. Sweet aroma of dark fruit and brown sugar. The flavor found dark fruits and a light alcohol backing. Light to medium body and sweet throughout.
Dark orange, quite foamy. Richly fruity aroma, malty and sweet with notes of light brown sugar and spices. Flavor of malts, sweet, with a fruits and spices and finishing bittersweet.

Tired.. so tired... bottle form out East somewhere.. my apologies, sir. Bottle pretty much exploded but I licked and slurped all the beer up off the papers on the table. Looked brown and murky but maybe that was the 8 pt font. Wonderful aroma of sweet caramel, mellow molasses, brown sugar, plums, spices and a bit of chocolate (not bitter). Tasty stuff even if its a bit too sweet. Brown sugar, touch of alcohol in the back ground, interesting bitterness especially when warmer, soft spice, toffee, a touch acidic, plums, sort type of chocolate related something - but not straight up chocolate. Goodness! Its 12:43, Im gassed... when will the 10% kick in?

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours deep brown with a lacy, cream-colored head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, lightly roasted and caramel and chocolate malts, some hops, and light alcohol notes.  Flavor dominated by the malts.  Smooth texture.  A really interesting beer, but I thought it would be more like a tripel.
Bottle pours a hazy amber with a thin white head. Scent is sugar, fruit and malts. Taste is malty with spices.

Thanks to BarZigKin for sharing his bottle.  Pours a dark cloudy reddish brown with a LOT of yeast particulate matter floating in the matrix.  Gorgeous nose of roasted nuts and brown sugar, its almost reminiscent of peanut brittle.  Sweet caramel flavor, some toffee and some yeast as well.  Overall, its tasty but the flavor is kinda hard to place.
75 cl bottle at home in Skövde. Amber, small beige head. Malty aroma, fruity, , figs and some toffee. Malty fruity flavor, raisins, figs, some hops, berries and toffee. A really nice beer :-)
4/5 in darkness. Smells caramell malty. Barry, sweet caramell malty taste with a sweet malty finish.

75 cl bottle. Amber beer with yeast,  small beige head. Malty sweetish aroma, fruity, roasted, figs and some toffee. Malty fruity flavor, raisins, figs, spicy notes, some hops, berries and toffee. Very drinkable.

Dark brown body, minimal white head. Strong aroma of caramel, chocolate, plum, brown sugar, spices and a hint of tobacco. Velvet palate. Sweet flavour with chocolate, dark fruits, some cereal, spices and caramel. A wonderful dark ale.

Courtesy of dazz3. Pours cloudy mahogany with a nice dark beige head leaving some lace. Aroma is fruity, berry, madeira, prunes, malty and sweet. Flavor is caramel, bitter, raisins, dark fruits, malty and alcohol. Finishes fruity and bitter sweet. Has a very nice balance.

(Bottle) Pours brown with an off-white head. The aroma holds malt and yeast up front with notes of toffee, cookies, earth and spices alongside a light fruitiness. Really robust nose. The flavor is near medium sweet, light bitter and tiny acidic. Tones of raisins, toffee, dark fudge, earth, light spicy, light fruity, leather and a touch of milk chocolate. The mouthfeel is round, smooth and light silky with light carbonation. Malty finish with a whisper of hay. Medium to full bodied.

Caramel copper color with a slight tinge of off-white foam.  Aroma is sweet, overly ripe raisins, candied sugar, and chewy fruit.  Taste is overly sweet candied sugar, raisin, date, and sweet malt.  Thick and syrupy feel in the mouth.

Bottle at the Delirium Cafe in Brussels.  Huge frothy, creamy head over a black beer, the head gradually recedes.  Presented in its own goblet glass.  Warming and spiced, goes down easily.  Smells spicet and a bit like gravy.  Its good, plenty to it.  Just lacks a little something though.  Pretty good and really spicy and sweet.
Just not complex enough for my tastes, as I look for a lot of complex fruit, raisin, etc. flavor in darker Belgian ales. Prefer their Brune over this one.

750ml from Gabriels in SA.  Dark brown body, creamy, tight head and tons of lacing left.  FLOATIES!!! Great beer if you want to weird someone out with a visual vs taste situation.  Aromas of rich, nuttyness, figs, sweet dark fruits and caramel.  Flavors of caramel, some toffee, carmelized sugars and light, earthy hops.  Medium to full mouthfeel.

Pour ruby brown with a ton of floaties beige head. Aroma caramel, dark fruit, maple, candy sugar, quite sweet, apples, pears, spices. Taste spice, apple, caramel, pear, candy sugar, brown sugar, dark fruits, light bitter on finish. MF medium to full sticky body with fine fizzy carb. Bottle did gush when opened not sure if this bottle was bad or not tasted quite good and had some unique flavor all in all solid. Thanks Slovaksniper!!!

Bottle at Delirium, Brussels. Dark brown. Spicy caramel aroma, yeasty, with figs. Deep dried fruit flavor, sweet, with caramel and chocolate, licorice, cinnamon. Wow! Soft and nicely fizzy, though maybe a touch too gassy. Great fruitiness.

Absolutely incredible. 
The aromas of spice, bread and brown sugar match the taste.

Its really a damn good Belgian.

Pours a bright ruby color with a big loose-ish head that fades into oblivion within a couple of minutes. The aroma is bread dough, plum, musty basement, and raisin. It doesnt sound like it smells very good when you write it out like that but its pungent, striking, and very appetizing. Fruitier aromas come through stronger as it warms giving the bouquet a soft cherry note. The flavor is really pretty spicy, I cant tell if its spiced or if that spiciness is fermentation driven, perhaps a combination of both. Either way the spiciness is striking and the beer has a bit of alcohol hotness right up front that eventually melds its self better into the beer becoming a nice complimentary flavor. The beer is really pretty dry for all the fruitiness and alcoholic strength. Plenty of autumnal nuttiness and mild roastiness show up as the beer warms this all sort of progresses into fruity pear and cherry notes. The mouthfeel is full but this doesnt come off as particularly viscous. 
My goodness I forget how much I enjoy some of these dark Belgian Strong Ales. This is a beautiful beer.

750ml bottle-pours a foamy dissipating light tan head and red/dark copper color.  Aroma is sweet medium malt-caramel/brown sugar, medium fruit, slight spice, yeast.  Taste is syrupy sweet medium malt-caramel/brown sugar, medium/dark fruit-raisin, nutmeg, slight spice hops, yeast.  Better at cellar temperature.

Pours medium brown with enough sediment to clog a small river. Head is light brown and moderate in size. Nose is molasses/syrup, apples, brown sugar, and a touch of belgian yeast and hops. Flavor is a rich clinic in sugars and yeast (not at all a surprise given the amount of sediment), with the malt more similar to a simple medley of sugars than to frutiness. Some bread quality is also present. Backside is both a little spiced and a little sour. Never noticed the 10% ABV in the flavor. Finish is very sticky and sweet. Excellent beer.

As a caveat, the bottle Im reviewing expired a year and a half ago. Nothing seemed to be terribly wrong,  or skunked, but mouthfeel and the chunkiness of the yeast may have been a little off.

Pours a medium brown with modest cream-colored head that disappeared quickly. Very large chunks of yeast (?) floating around and sticking to the sides of the glass. Looked a little gross, but I honestly couldnt detect the large chunks as I drank it.

Aroma is awesome: dried fruits like raisin, dark cherry, apple. Flavor is again dried fruit, with sugars and caramel, a little spiciness. Wonderfully rich and balanced.

Very mild finish. Alcohol taste almost completely absent.

Mouthfeel is a little to syrupy for my taste-- but again, the age of my bottle may have something to do with it.

750 ml Bottle; Pour is the most ridiculous thus far in my career. I open the bottle, tilt it to pour, and the liquid pauses in spite of gravity in the neck for a moment. Why? Because this bottle has so many giant turds of yeast present that I actually pulled out a strainer for it to pull out the big, brown pieces floating around. I was thinking to myself; "perhaps they added raisins to each bottle..... no, that cant be right" Anyway - This brew is murky brown with amber highlights in this glass ; the beige head starts off modestly and doesnt retain well at all; very light, spotty lacing is present in this glass. Because of my straining, the amount of yeast present went from giant dark brown blobs to more typical beige sediment, at least more typical for me. Anyway - The nose is dark fruits and light spices, coupled with belgian sugars. The flavor profile brings out some of this yeast; raisins, light booze, belgian sugars, and a light breadiness is present as well. I enjoyed the beer as I expected, and would be interested to try it again from a smaller, newer bottle honestly.

Poured a amber dark brown color.  Flavors of belgium yeasts, sweet candy, raisons.  Very complex.  Medium sweetness.  Medium body.  Creamier texture.  Nice carbonation feel.  Very complex.  Alcohol is hidden.  Well done.  I will add this to my list to get again.
Bottle. Muddy amber colour with large creamy off-white mostly lasting head. Malty aroma with notes of dark fruits. Sweet spicy flavor. Lasting finish. Creamy palate.

Draft at Imbibe Wine on the way back on my bicycle from a 26 mile ride. Great pit stop! Nose of brown sugar, candi sugar, and raisins. Hazy rust brown with a small beige head. Flavor is moderately sweet, prunes, caramel, and a hint of tartness.

11.2oz bottle split with mcberko. Pours a cloudy orange/red - lots of sediment. Aroma of dark fruits - plums, syrups. Flavour of yeast, toffee, plums, booze hints. Carbonation leaves a warming sensation on the palate. Becomes fruitier with every sip. Lovely!

11.2 oz. bottle, pours a murky dark red with a beige head. Aroma of caramel, maple syrup, treacle / toffee, candied sugar and Belgian yeast - suggesting quite a sweet palate. Flavour is quite sweet, with maple syrup upfront, caramel, candied sugar and yeast, with a lingering syrupy sweet finish.
Bottle. Pours chunky brown with a beige head. Fruity aroma with spicy yeasty notes. The flavor is plummy and jammy with spicy and fruity notes. Nice.

Bottle 750ml @ home
[Trade by Dedollewaitor] Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Picked up a bottle of this at State Line. Served in a wine glass.

Pours dark brown with a slight head that falls to a thin collar and a galaxy cap. Spins out to a thin collar throughout. The nose is not clearly as sweet as the Brune. There is a stronger plum/prune character with some very slight spice. There is some grape in the nose. The taste is dry without too much sweetness. A bit of mild earthy character; maybe some slight hints of tobacco. There are plum and dark fruits as well. Mild date character. The finish is a bit too dry and mildly astringent. Strange, somewhat-sharp dryness there. No booze at all, which is quite impressive. Drinkable but nowhere near the level of the Brune.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-29-2010

Medium reddish brown with a small beige head that becomes a ring. There are a ton of esters floating around which is a little offputting to me. Lots of toffee and caramel in the aroma, smoothed out by plums, raisins, milk chocolate, doughy yeast. The flavors are similar to the aroma, with the same milk chocolate coming through. There is a gram cracker note on the finish. Very sweet all the way through, with smooth, warming alcohol. Medium body with very little carbonation. Pretty good after dinner drink.

The beer pours a dark brown with lots of amber highlights. There is a ton of yeast floaties moving about. The head is tan, noting special....The aroma is malty, brown sugar prunes, caramel, a lighter yeastier quad. Not bad... The taste is pruney tea with yeast. Really pretty boring but drinkable. 

This is a re-review, really much lower than the original review
Medium sediment, strong maltiness mixed with fruitiness.  Overall, a very good Belgian Strong Ale, slightly unique.

750ml bottle.
Pours hazy brown with a small amount of head.  Aromas and flavors of dark fruit and candy sugar.  Complex and delicious.

head: white , creamy 
colour: dark brown, clear 
smell: malts, grapes, candy sugar, plums, sweet, bit vintage 
taste: wine in the start, sweet malts, irony/bloody taste, bit sour, brutt champagne flavour, sweet taste, semi-dry , grassy hops after

300 ml bottle, BB date reads 20. December 2012, into baby Chimay (180 ml) chalice. Pours sparkling beige head that slowly recedes (later pours exhibit less head retention) to a firm cloth atop of hazy, deep coppery-brown body with loads of tiny yeast particles. The floaties are not loathsome by any means and only enhance the natural aspects of the beer. Aroma is rich malty sweetness with honeyish notes, fruity esters of plum, raisin and dried cherries, nutmeg-like spiciness, faint peppery phenolics and nearly imperceptible alcohol. Flavor is rich, almost Mucih-type like malty sweetness with bready overtones, dried dark fruits, nutmeg and subtle bitterness, however, the balance is entirely towards the malt. Finishes sweet. Medium to full bodied, viscous and creamy with soft carbonation, tends to coat the lips with gooish sweet film.

In short: a rich malty, fruity brew with nutmeg-like spiciness and sticky texture.

Loads of sediment, small head, deep brown, very very viscous, only loses points for the tremendous amount of sediment and the inherent visually unappealing sensation that that imparts... Tons of dark fruits, strong dark aroma candi sugar sweeter... Amazing depth of flavor, loads of dark fruits mildly sweet some caramel, very very complex... Full bodied, chewy, a little dry in the finish, deftly balanced... Awesome flavor, belgian yeast is subtle...

Abbaye Des Rocs
Triple Imperiale
Pours medium brown with a medium tan head and ok retention. Looks a bit hazy. Aroma of strong dark fruits, raisins, yeast, caramel and alcohol. Smells nice! Taste is super yummy with a clean crispy finish. Notes of dark fruits all over with a nice maltiness and a good booze note. Will purchase again.

750 ml bottle. Pretty bad appearance, 2nd glass out of the bottle and already full of chunks. The aroma is classic abbaye des rocs - they really have the rich plum and spice aroma down to a tee. Very belgian (yeasty). Taste is very fruity, more plums, cherries, a bit of alcohol and a lot of spicy belgian yeast. Palate is good, heavy and creamy with just enough carbonation.

Bottle from Beer Planet. Dark brown body with puffy, tan head. Nose of Malts and sweet. Taste of fruits, berries, chocolate, coffee, lots and lots of nice things. Really good. Really enjoying this one.

Bouteille de 330ml. Une belle mousse beige trône sur une bière acajou-orangée. De forts arômes surets se dégagent du premier nez, En bouche le mélange est complexe, des notes surettes, du caramel, une touche mordante. La fin de bouche est longue avec des notes de noix grillés et une touche dalcool.
Draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo, NY. dark raisiny brown color. Boozy, raisins, caramel malt richness. Agressive flavor of rasins, booze, rich malts. a sipper no doubt. a tad too boozy & rich for me

Le liquide dévoile une robe brune foncée.  Lénorme tête mousseuse se transforme rapidement en un mince anneau.  Au nez, les fleurs de houblons se cachent derrière des notes fruitées et maltées: le raisin suret et une fine liqueur dorange se confondent avec un malt doux et collant aux accents de bonbon au caramel.  Le goût ne détonne pas et expose lui aussi toute la richesse de ses malts sucrés, de sa levure épicée et de ses notes fruitées qui me semblent encore une fois surettes et touchées ici par des petites notes boisées.  En bouche, le liquide a une structure étoffée avec une effervescence au neutre et une texture crémeuse.  La finale se fait sur des notes maltées et épicées avec un alcool timidement floral et pratiquement tiède.

Given the word triple on the bottle, I was not expecting this to pour the ruddy brown color that it does.The head is white and long lasting, which is nice, but this is balanced by an over abundance of particulates that wound up in my rather carefully poured glass. Rum and raisins dominate the nose w/ some apple sweetness and a tart, almost tannic note. The texture of this is way off, cloyingly sweet w/ weird gelatinous chunks of yeast sliding across the tongue. The carbonation is OK but thats about all the good I can say about. Taste is pretty much as expected given the nose, rather fruity and bit tart. There is a bit of an oxidized sherry character that is rather enjoyable but overall this is OK at best and it really has some major flaws working against it.

Draft. Poured a murky brown color. The head was tan and dense, not quite a meringue, but close. Nice aroma of dark fruits, light caramel, and a bit of alcohol. Medium bodied and sweet with a warming alcohol effect. I tasted rum raisin cake, toffee, and candy sugar. Nice beer.

330ml bottle, a little bit gushing at the opening of the bottle, dark brown color, with a small almost ring tan head, nice belgian yeasty, fruity nose with some peachy, orange, tangerine peel, pruney, raisiny esters, with a hint of coriander spiciness, with some toasted, caramelized, biscuity malt accents, and a soft floral lavender petal, jasmine note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth good yeasty, fruity, peachy, apricot, orange, tangerine peel, spicy coriander, curaçao spicy character with some toasted, caramelized, biscuity, chocolate malt notes, with a sweet brown sugar flavor, leading towards a warming, malty, fruity candied orange, tangerine peel, spicy, floral herbal lavender chocolatey finish

bottle pours dark brown with a medium light tan head.  Nice dark fruit and dry yeast aroma with notes of caramel.  Flavor is rich, very bready, but remains dry like a typical triple ending with notes of green raisin and brown sugar.

Bottle from Beer World, Brussels. Pours a murky nougat brown body with a big, fluffy near-caramel head. Aroma is toffee, dark malts and airy, fruity hop notes and hints of caramel and dried plumes. Taste is caramel pudding, toffee, Belgian yeast, dark malts and voluminous, almost aerial hints of dark plumes and booze. Delicate and balanced, and very sweet. A nice Belgian strong ale that stands out a bit from the crowd.

Bottle at Delirium. Pours a dark brown color with a huge beige head. The aroma is toasted malts, candies, nutty, smooth caramel and yeast. The flavor is similar; a smooth hot Ale with nutty, caramel, sugary, and dark fruit flavors. Very well made.

Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Very hazy with floaties. Small light brown head. Aroma of fruits, chocolate, light alcohol, yeast, spice. Flavour of yeast, spice, chocolate, light sterin, ripe fruits. Medium to full bodied. Yeast, sweet and fruity end. I have been looking for this for years, and then suddenly one of my non beergeeky friends place it on my kitchentable. Thx Max.

33cl bottle bought at the brewery.
Very dark amber. Yeast, malt, wood in aroma. Same in the very rich taste with some additional spices, cant detect which. Extremely sweet, tones of candy sugar, too much for me.

Hazy brown/copper body with an average off-white foamy head. Well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with grainy and woody hints. Alcohol is perfectly hidden. Its malty/hoppy taste carries fruity. brown sugar and yeasty notes. Ends with a warming bittersweet finish. Very good!

330ml bottle bought in Belgium. Dark amber. Almoust brown. Head is brown. Aroma: sweet, cola, rubber, rasin, dark fruits. Flavor: Sweet dark fruits, malty and burnt sugar and cola. Palate is medium big.

Bottle pour to Trappist glass.  Dark ruby-brown with thick persistent tan head.  Had the usual floaties which I filtered out.  Aroma of dark fruits.  Taste very sweet, raisins, figs  Really the dark fruits overpowered everything else about the beer.  palate thick, carbonated, sticky and cloying.  Finish a bit sour and fruity.  Alcohol apparent but overall disguised.

Way too sweet and sticky for me.

Bottle at Delirium in Brussels. Deep mahogany pour, big frothy head-- no wonder Ratebeer doesnt classify this as a true tripel. Aroma holds strawberry, plum, molasses, and raisin- excellent dark fruit on the nose. Flavor is marked by huge notes of peach nectar, more plum, sweet cranberry, and impressive light yeast notes for such a dark brew. Amazing combo of light and flavorful like a tripel, but with the dark fruit depth of a Belgian strong. Hides the alcohol amazingly well. Excellent.
Nice aroma, slightly uneven appearance with unusually coarse head for its style; hints of fruit with good palate feel.

33cl. bottle. Pours out with floating stuff around, looks as bad as the grand cru... I dont like to look to floating stuff in my beer, it looks disgusting in my opinion. Dark brown-orange-amber coloured. Lightly beige, good sized and holding head. Sticks a bit to the glass. Heavy smell, dark/red fruity, sweet. Caramel and prunes. Bitter-sour taste of red fruits with caramel that makes the beer taste a bit sweeter. The taste is not bad, but the tought at feeling of floating stuff in my beer... It makes me think its the second time someone drinks this...

Bottle from Bruisin Ales in Asheville.  Silly me, expecting a tripel.  When it poured deep copper I had to come check and make sure it wasnt a rotten beer.  The smell indicated otherwise, for sure.  Sweet dark fruits... figs and raisins mixed in with some lighter tripel-like notes of citrus and overripe peach.  Some brown sugar.  A little bit cloying, but no alcohol burn for a 10% beer.  Good, but a bit sweet for me.

Dark amber/cider color with light particles; Medium creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit, caramel, & toffee; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit (notably plums & figs), raisons, caramel, and some chocolate; Palate has a syrup quality; Nicely balanced and complex; Very good overall.
33 cl bottle. Very dark ruby/brown with small long lasting beige head. Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit, sweet, notes of alcohol and spices.
Bottle. Copper with lasting thin foam head. Big alcohol nose with strong brown sugar. Dark coffee cake, sweet notes, and sugary topping. Very sweet with strong alcohol.

Have not been impressed with this brewery at all.  I think these beers are all overrated.  Pours a reddish brown color with an off-white soapy head.  Has an aroma of vinegar, dark fruit, with hints of caramel.  Has a bitter tart taste with a malty aftertaste.  It would be better without the toffee notes on the finish.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2012 33 cl bottle, pours dark amber with a minor head,  aroma is toffee, dark fruit, brown sugar and bit roasty, taste is very sweet consisting of dark fruit, diacetyl, toffee and some alcohol.

(bottle) pours a hazy ruby-orange colour with a frothy off-white head and lots of floaties. aroma of sweet spices and alcohol, bread, yeast and dark fruits, with a hint of brown sugar, quite complex and smooth. flavour is the same, with lots of doughy bready notes in the foreground, some toasted malts and a slightly alcoholic warming finish. medium to strong body, slightly watery surprisingly, with smooth carbonation.

33cl bottle from IPB
Appearance :Dark amber, small head. Not much lacing.

Aroma : Quite spicy and nutty. Sugary with some yeast. Some alcohol. Notes of raisins.

Taste : Sugary and yeasty. A bit nutty with some spices. Finish is yeasty and spicy. Nutty also. Carbonation is rather soft. Strong presence of raisins.
